FA6751DF11FC4A98B13A6A6B08EF144E.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

AA8F097ABD11493E950D2E0F5AB8D55F.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

60FF509DA67A4123A0A79C0EE421FFF1.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

6FAC15553E7349ACB411C0760301D7CA.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

B3B2D3842B474127874A53480E7A2219.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

0CF842375B5147DCA7C707F8045D4335.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

0CC8272D46514B70A8286996C316B4FC.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

CE4BBC657CBD4385B0660CFD8EA3D573.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

E7750B6EC7FA48D79FD32454F14F8431.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

6AE32145AFC24863ABA1CD5CFDB31DDE.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

87D694D704E04C9E978B7F1431399A2A.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

C3CACA5834774B2EA1373DED3AA26A3F.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

35633560B55F438C839A3360709A1FB3.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

803A544F10894D0A89D14C063C2727F8.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?.

530B4C8844D846038BEDA067BB6CA271.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

BD9098359C3346068EE5B09C45BD81C2.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution.

A475DE1F4932435EB812E29635A4A8EE.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

D5ED133D84724D1E8C8753475638E195.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

E2E9452237D447F687D30D33E247BCF0.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

6915FBE288DA43038BACF866EDC213D1.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

430ADC2EF8D5490F80FC33E1E26BD4BB.description: Research processes and criteria for allocating grants or providing commercial sponsorship and create an application for funding for a theatre project, real or imagined.

386AA47883F54E2B9CE358A199B8B0D7.description: Investigate entrance requirements and scholarship opportunities for application to post-secondary theatre programs.

30E33F41CC4440D98500D6FC25087853.description: Identify Canadian organizations (e.g., Canada Council for the Arts, Organization of Saskatchewan Arts Councils) that provide supports (e.g., grants, professional development, networking opportunities) for theatre professionals within the arts and cultural sector.

8D4A9ADC963444F9B40347063BF1F91E.description: Identify Canadian and international post-secondary technical theatre programs and review entrance requirements.

5BD979A82CCC400B930CE359D5BAC117.description: Design a potential career path that includes post-secondary education programs for a chosen technical theatre occupation.

90EC921BE11E4AAC81175E9D9E64A930.description: Reflect upon personal suitability or non-suitability for specific occupations in theatre arts.

4DF3C4DC0D6C41D581E63F51A5E36413.description: Examine paid employment and volunteer opportunities in a variety of roles (e.g., theatre boards, arts councils, volunteering for arts organizations and theatre companies).

8A4174F83C47406994A9F27DB72D9048.description: Research Canadian and international theatre arts professionals to identify their training, work and career paths.

23EF941835D348AF94A9FBDDF8A0563C.description: Investigate the role and impact of various unions involved in theatrical productions (e.g., International Association of Technical Stage Employees – IATSE).

5E80D7A6399D4BE7B6DD84EA43F9DB2C.description: Assess the current state of theatre arts occupations in Canada and compare to international theatres and other performance contexts.

65B7B8B8471141FCB9808FC74AAA13B8.description: Discuss how theatre locations, local community support and economic conditions may affect job prospects and sustainability in theatre and the arts sector in Canada.

1846EEA3BD724121B5EA6722428C06A7.description: Investigate theatre arts careers and post-secondary opportunities in Canada and internationally.

00925B862E1549218F430CAF1157D1E8.description: Career Opportunities in Theatre Arts B (Core)

30A478101DD040899B2DB0859D01BB04.description: Present evidence (e.g., in a portfolio or resume) of personal skills and abilities demonstrated during the production, drawing on production documentation and personal reflections (e.g., on responsibilities and tasks performed, on opportunities for creative problem solving and innovation prior to and during the production).

3CDE78833E504D09853EB9941C03BD3E.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal goals and learning outcomes and share what was learned with others.

8AC2FB62ED1A413A86EC82E68562AB74.description: Assess the enjoyment, fulfilment and challenges derived from interacting with others and from the creative process of working on a production.

D4F5665499C84A1EB5090654C8C6FCA5.description: Discuss learning that occurred and problems, surprises or challenges that arose during the production and how they were resolved.

8E23F9DD44954AFC9894BCB966F49505.description: Explore decisions made by various roles (e.g., director, actor, designer) to achieve intent.

A68449A24A014748B9CD841EEF0F6735.description: Analyze the use of leadership and collaborative skills during planning and production.

E8F83C24D4344612B7DBA39A40102501.description: Demonstrate awareness of career and employment opportunities of personnel involved in working on a theatre production.

6A8727A764A449078C160D6F1E5362DF.description: Reflect on what has been accomplished and assess growth resulting from theatrical production project work.

58BB8DCB8D6746888C4A44A8C720C5A9.description: Plan and facilitate a post-production review of practical experiences.

76BE29FD65A844728BB375CD99426D0D.description: Develop or update a resume and/or portfolio highlighting theatre arts experiences, knowledge and skills.

2A3B6DB128A648C1BB7E506B57732E1E.description: Reflect on own work, including successes and opportunities for improvement, during planning, production and post-production review.

689A9BB59AD945C4B125587E10F46B02.description: Analyze decisions made by various roles (e.g., director, actor, designer) to achieve intent.

DD934828647846CD9741133B133E4D69.description: Use a specific technical component (e.g., light, costume, sound, digital technologies) for symbolic purposes as a mode for communicating ideas.

1C424B16D0A443F7ABF60FF1E673F40A.description: Reinterpret or imagine a scene or dramatic work through innovative use of various theatrical toolboxes (e.g., director, designer, actor).

57602D32721B46A2A533B8DA2B800D42.description: Explore directors’ and/or designers’ toolboxes (e.g., communication of vision, interpretation of oral or written text, analysis and planning, creating a rehearsal plan) for artistic and technical purposes.

AF2A6DC6C1254BDB855DBEC4FC45361A.description: Document ideas and processes used during the production.

A444D481F57B42D294061B70A966F27A.description: Collaborate with others to bring production ideas to reality.

3328873539784C05A185948257A5C890.description: Create a vision board or use another method to record, reflect on and imagine ideas for the production.

7E6BE40B03CB4893901E76EE6182B4E3.description: Generate and develop ideas in one’s production team area.

4804667731894452907E579AF7BC0F64.description: Attend all production team meetings and demonstrate leadership and innovative thinking throughout the project.

66BC8F30EFE44E67AD71468E9CA3939E.description: Review the roles and responsibilities of various department heads, co- ordinators and team members to determine various collaborative processes required.

8FFFB35E94764F668970BBE61945E112.description: Present a proposal for assuming a role as a department coordinator or team leader for a theatrical production project.

730DF572A9FB4C3A9D1B8EC0543501E8.description: Demonstrate independence when heading a department or taking on a leadership role in a theatrical production project.

5AFCF4F5266E416293998F70730CFAEF.description: Demonstrate communication skills and organizational abilities in planning for a production project.

6E3FE2BD7CAD4252854E12AA8257146B.description: Select or agree to assume production team tasks and demonstrate collaborative and leadership abilities in planning and production of a theatre arts project.

5E9AAF8DAC494A5F8635878F2831D243.description: Discuss the role of verbal and non-verbal communication during work- related projects and consider ways both communication methods may be interpreted or misinterpreted on the job.

FBF7A59466DF4F0C9892BE35E341DE6E.description: Participate in a simulation activity for production project tasks and create a theatre log in which to record tasks.

D4E2E88D6BC74E39B2C691238D7650F4.description: Review tasks required of design and production team members (e.g., stage, lighting, sound, set construction, set painting, properties, wardrobe, makeup or box office crew) for a school or community production.

52D4EE9E30D9412B8E2A1435A1CEA97B.description: Determine personal interests, experiences and other factors that may affect how one could contribute to a theatrical production project.

2B36A4ADA566456C840D77D4D29FB14A.description: Demonstrate independence in preparing for one or more team member roles in a theatrical production project.

C88089CDB92D42ABAD62413683CE2B2A.description: Analyze and reflect on the challenges encountered, problems solved and overall effectiveness of one’s production management work.

2844CE693620468BA4B38BF5BF9AF1EE.description: Demonstrate organizational and communication skills (e.g., scheduling rehearsals, coordinating acquisition of resources and materials, collaborating with director and department heads) when assuming or supporting the role of production manager.

F573CFA009F541C3AE0ABEC8FFB5050A.description: Create a production plan, assign roles and develop a budget and a timeline.

294E46FB11344CDCB1C89AAB88946759.description: Research and discuss the functions of production manager such as: creating and maintaining a budget for a production that accounts for all design aspects (e.g., technical director, production manager, stage director, construction coordinator or manager); organizing items required for the show to run smoothly; hiring, creating contracts and supervising technical staff (e.g., designers, scenic artists); maintaining cast and crew contact information; collaborating with director and department heads to make decisions about funding for sets, costumes, lighting, sound and other areas to ensure the production stays within budget; keeping stage and backstage areas organized; creating and adjusting schedules for the production including meeting times and locations and the use of rehearsal space and other rooms; calling the first production meeting with team members such as director, designers and stage crews); and, ensuring technical aspects of production are completed in a safe and timely manner.

E4524F2BC6AF4015B61AA804335AF115.description: Assume the role of production manager for a theatrical production, real or imagined.

CD6254FDC42A4B8F93FF9CCE99A12D6D.description: Reflect on the effectiveness of the marketing and publicity campaign.

D0207551597C4349B854865B91DC07F6.description: Carry out a publicity campaign for a production, real or imagined, considering examples such as: organizing pop-up performances; targeting social media influencers; creating contests; circulating cast and production crew trading cards; and, making and posting a teaser or video trailer, considering permissions required for a copyright play and the potential use of audio voiceovers.

2232399495FD49A39D46458137840C33.description: Develop a marketing campaign, for a real or imagined production, considering strategies such as: creating press and publicity lists of local contacts and influencers; inviting partnerships of mutual interest with local organizations (e.g., local bakery providing food, local print company sponsoring posters); organizing interviews for cast and crew with local media (e.g., broadcast, print, online); making and distributing press and social media packages; inviting local media to rehearsal; creating a podcast with cast members and production team members talking about the show; conducting backstage video tour to post on social media; creating and distributing merchandise such as t-shirts or ball caps to market beforehand and sell during performance breaks.

035E9CC5391F45F0B63C2912F2142591.description: Discuss the potential impact of poor marketing.

409ED9A3483745F1BCEEA4E464DB23E7.description: Examine the value marketing can provide to theatres and individual theatrical productions.

A960B6C4C2594E8D939D1EBD0838586D.description: Design a marketing campaign and create publicity materials for a theatre production, real or imagined.

0B869490DCBD41E3843271F6EAA232E2.description: Demonstrate attention to detail, time management, quality customer service and communication skills with audience and theatre personnel.

7ABBF6183BCD4BA68109B31C360202B2.description: Examine ways to ensure safety and increase efficiency in the performance of duties.

6E7FEF6704304916BBE3445CCF309639.description: Create a house manager's handbook for the school's theatre or performance facility and include items such as seating, house rules, emergency and evacuation procedures, audience calls and communication.

10E2B85A37904D569A094CD2875C451C.description: Research and describe the functions of front of house manager including responsibilities such as: training front of house team; collaborating with team members such as box office, ushers, stage manager, public relations, media and publicity; managing and running box office reservations and ticket sales; reviewing traffic flow and emergency evacuation procedures (e.g., fire exits, emergency restrictions); preparing the space to ensure front of house area and auditorium are ready for the show (e.g., organizing programmes and ushers);making arrangements for classes or workshops in theatre space; managing events (e.g., hosting meetings, parties or fundraisers); developing concession policy and arranging for refreshments, food or merchandise; and, working with building supervisor and maintenance to ensure building security and health and safety of team members and patrons.

C386CA6E9A4447FEBA1B48A2DE027C2C.description: Assume the role of front of house manager for a production.

742D593260774E298CF16800BA4C4A1A.description: Examine ethics, protocols and procedures for worker advocacy and psychological safety.

C11CEB10F0754F749702433B2B3CB774.description: Collaborate with peers to develop a Theatre Arts Code of Ethics for a student production, real or imagined.

F372C4CB1093462893DA75C134CE2EA1.description: Discuss advantages and disadvantages of being employed in a workplace where workers are unionized or non-unionized.

D2A9182158A9473083598B1AFE1C3B54.description: Discuss ethics environments (e.g., being inspired by others versus stealing ideas, copyright infringement versus permissions granted, mutual respect among theatre arts teams [e.g., actors, playwrights, directors, technical crews]) in theatre arts.

E5D12F2B310F44DCABDACD4C3A8E8279.description: Examine, with advice from First Nations and Métis artists or Knowledge Keepers, protections and protocols related to Indigenous traditional knowledge, cultural expressions and appropriate use (e.g., traditional gifting of stories, dances, songs, symbols, images) including issues related to cultural appropriation.

A377D28DA37E42ECB5E13FBAFAB33D06.description: Discuss the impact of ethical (e.g., responsibility, honesty, confidentiality, obtaining permissions) and unethical (e.g., using artistic ideas or creations without permission, bullying, sexual harassment) behaviours on individuals and workplaces in the theatre industry.

7C7FB8ABADB84DB69E9B75BD6D143F33.description: Examine ethical practices and intellectual property in theatre arts.

2530346E361D41EA8D7F72CC32DE7FD2.description: Coordinate set-up and strike of a production and arrange transportation (e.g., of properties or set pieces) as required.

B4F15CC1CD30496686A618DC60EC0506.description: Call all cues including light, sound and deck cues.

95D37EB36A1E41ACB8ECEA40AB85C819.description: Create prompt script including actors’ cues and requirements for properties, lighting and sound.

E252CE29B59C48A1BB9FDC1B5F173D90.description: Manage the backstage and onstage areas during performances.

6ED3D9BEA01B45C0BF5A4F6468F99EF2.description: Collaborate with the sound team to set up a video monitor so that off-stage cast can see and hear what is happening on stage.

F4FC95E262B64AD9B757694799837028.description: Manage the production callboard, including sign-in sheets and announcements.

D555D94427BB4A6DB69873868F04E20B.description: Discuss expectations and requirements (e.g., off-stage monitors for cast, intercom headsets for stage manager and technicians, body microphones) for facilitating backstage communications.

EB27BF98D96D49D48CAABE11A417CEE8.description: Oversee safety aspects of a production.

A48EAFACB1B64E498BE87E52F2684E89.description: Record lighting and sound cues in production book before technical rehearsal.

644997E2C6CC488998997C236510DA6A.description: Ensure effective communication among production team members and cast members.

919704E8C37F493693A37F1AE9D5216D.description: Develop a plan for the return of properties.

67945A4E3AC54BDABEA36D5E5B4FCFA3.description: Create and maintain a master properties list and plan.

4DE143D4443E49048E0D5D9E3ED69B0D.description: Source and maintain furniture and properties.

C520FE43A5C6446DA49E5B3A500DFF4B.description: Call and monitor attendance of actors and crew during rehearsals and performances.

28520F7A3545483E86F7259629E5CF56.description: Create rehearsal and performance schedules in collaboration with director.

D45FE3A6631F43A1AD677F9FD65A7ECB.description: Examine the process and criteria for expanding a stage manager’s role to include an assistant stage manager and/or backstage manager.

023945DFE2C14D09A8C2B2784E151C2B.description: Collaborate with production manager to develop production team budgets and rehearsal schedule.

0C0AB64E3227485DB4C70C1E1DA290C0.description: Assume the role and responsibilities of stage manager.

446D750DCB00469BA2A7329244A42869.description: Support cleanup after all rehearsals and performances.

599D2BE279354504ABCB0C9A60A52C9D.description: Create and maintain a master properties list and plan (e.g., properties table, pre-set, stage left, stage right).

2952BA8E827748F896766BA7DE3417BB.description: Examine ways of managing properties backstage: running list; pre-set list; properties tables; and, consumables.

43EE8788CE48406D9DBA75A57FD36B4F.description: Examine methods of organizing properties by acquisition (e.g., pulled, borrowed, adapted/transformed, created) and type (e.g., rehearsal, hand, costume and set).

04CACC5716C241A69B5D31F4CC28B8CB.description: Assist the properties team and coordinate furniture and properties during rehearsals and production.

B8AEB33C6EAA41ABB3F17B9E3420F782.description: Organize backstage storage areas for rehearsals and performances in collaboration with team members.

049BB3F53E6C4CA78102917CC3F5AC63.description: Take line notes when actors are off book and prompt actors as needed.

8DB66BAB8CDA41C49C95E14C3F93D7C9.description: Record director’s blocking in production book.

1010F5A6D977462F81B43B6F355A9ACB.description: Distribute scripts and prepare cast and crew contact lists.

B21B3F66040E4CA0B8C50482DC5E6607.description: Assist with the creation of schedules (e.g., for rehearsals, deadlines and performances).

F645DA0F6A594904BFE8180EBDE3D632.description: Maintain rehearsal and production call sheets.

B1B578136CBC44A48B90A853187BF2BB.description: Liaise between, and support communication among, production team members.

CFF95766284848B78F14E29E65E09E84.description: Attend production team meetings and take notes.

2561BCFF35C34BC5A8A2EB263A3FB484.description: Assist with stage manager rehearsal and production responsibilities.

64EC506754024EADBD6E843133BDB0D3.description: Create an inspirational ideas bank of innovative designs, special effects and technological innovations, for various staging purposes.

4BC1781337DF4D6889E4F6B983E493DB.description: Apply technical innovation in both the rehearsal and performance phases of a production, as opportunities arise.

748AB68264504D49AA4D2300435A7167.description: Identify and propose solutions for potential challenges when using projections (e.g., removing and cleaning filters, changing lamps, avoiding error messages, keystone correction, use of deflector mirrors, adjusting theatrical lighting to improve projected images).

A924ED7B6E444107BE009A77AF460F7F.description: Use software and applications for the creation of illusions and special effects for various purposes on stage.

B1CB5F4274CB4839A2C115E6B145C4AD.description: Research digital innovations (e.g., projections, immersive environments) and experiment with video, sound, lighting and projection design for theatre, real or imagined.

5611FE87265445798A09A099643B56F2.description: Explore technologies used to create effects such as moving platforms, computerized video projections, moveable screens or scenery, kinetic features and sound and lighting effects.

71542BF3DA3744E8B384CD77BDDA66AF.description: Use non-digital and digital technologies to create effects such as rain, snowstorms or fire.

BFB81BED72AF44639194D55992887885.description: Identify and practise safety precautions and procedures, including a fire drill, when working with staging, equipment and chemicals.

550B464661B34D55941153A8760D72AF.description: Examine how designers in theatre incorporate machinery and digital technologies to create illusions and special effects such as: raked stages; revolves; scrims; drops; fog, smoke, fire, haze; cycloramas; rain and water effects; and, flying set pieces.

FF4C969F80B749549A057CC1D8583B7C.description: Assess the impact of innovations in digital technologies on design and special effects in theatre production.

F8732CACA9A047F8ADC72B0ED621D61A.description: Theatre Innovations in the Digital Age (Optional)

6A0FFABEE4684D3B87504E1C2FA5AAB5.description: Identify and practise safety precautions and procedures when working with projection equipment.

59D80A0AA17F48B3A583985442F9AC81.description: Create an inspirational ideas bank of designs that use projections for various purposes.

1CC05200943A4351B098248A5AF6FE0E.description: Experiment with different types of projection screens (e.g., white screens versus black screens versus gray, blank walls, painted portable plywood screen, painter’s plastic stretched on a frame, existing cyclorama, Screen Goo painted surfaces, fabric screens, rear-projection screen or frosted shower curtains) and adjust stage lighting to compare results (e.g., black screens transmit less light than white but have more contrast and resist unwanted ambient light).

471D3AAF5C974F0682B8F246C85C1B6B.description: Experiment with the creation and refinement of projections (e.g., replacing constructed set design items with still images, comparing presentation software, trying short-throw lens, projecting moving images, adjusting theater lighting, avoiding unwanted shadows, playing with fades and transitions).

5A431E315ECF4956AC3FB7255F4A9D85.description: Investigate different ways to create projections considering technical specifications and factors such as the projectors’ lumens, throw distance, throw ratio, physics of light, intensity of light and direction.

9785FCD1D23D497382E1A52AE83E684A.description: Explore ways that projections (e.g., front versus rear, slideshow software, animation and other video, shadow play) can be created and used in theatre.

2FBA026B90A94910ABAAA1A4CACA3B14.description: Discuss projection design processes (e.g., researching, storyboarding, acquiring images or footage, editing, installing, controlling).

E83B8377D18D478A83D7C8AD8D6D8F6C.description: Investigate the functions of projection design and use of projection systems and technologies.

DE28572F7A6D4186BB3898BC9E2043FF.description: Apply technical skills to create stage projections that incorporate projection design.

4F1D873F8665438CB69F783E5C249F5F.description: Identify opportunities (e.g., awards events, music concerts) and/or venues (e.g., places of worship, sports facilities) where sound design expertise could be shared or applied.

B650541AFB2E4266A4AED192225EB8DB.description: Reflect on personal interest in, and skills for, sound design.

2BA25F38C1A940B5937219F8A539C97F.description: Demonstrate the ability to solve sound/sound design problems in a real or imagined situation.

FD39C6EAD89E40BAA30C6D0A9C6F1EFC.description: Create a sound plot or cue sheet and sound system layout after blocking has been determined.

BFA38FADCE4A483ABF0DA1CA1BFD4ABC.description: Design sound for a real or imagined multi-set play, musical or devised drama/theatre production using actual or interactive online sound equipment, applications and/or simulators and explain the rationale for choices.

F20D3FBE53E74C50987924E170E7DC72.description: Discuss how sound design interacts with other design (e.g., costume, set, makeup) decisions.

D5716675E7904A4683DACADB9A2CA4C4.description: Prepare sound equipment (e.g., speakers, microphones, headsets) for use.

0A83366898844C578556AE2B8054BFEF.description: Practise safety precautions when working with sound equipment.

26D1AFB05A0041F5A9258D559375CA36.description: Discuss how facility or other location affects the sound design.

FFEB1A2E25894ADD93679CE5FF4A3FD8.description: Select, create, record and run sound effects and incidental music for a production or part of a production.

53CC9DD0E2704AE4A72A0B834E1D6880.description: Research and experiment with special effects in sound.

8D63E188398D46C3854D3083B714F435.description: Create a sound design for a real or imagined multi-set play, musical or devised drama/theatre production.

AA8D4B74FC3D440D9C7CA99229AA943E.description: Reflect on challenges experienced and personal accomplishments in sound design.

DC744B1F820243CB9923A7BB279F6C30.description: Demonstrate ability to problem solve in a real or imagined situation.

9219EE5FCFF74BA794FB51CE380EA116.description: Determine sound requirements, create a design and use notation to organize cues for a real or imagined production.

1ACCC1B49ACC4CAB86736B4E2A931D21.description: Examine and discuss sound design documents such as: sound plot; sound cue sheet; and, patch sheet.

66A17718D4E84753AF7CD280FD92E098.description: Identify the different requirements (e.g., variety of microphones and how they are used) for a musical versus non-musical production.

BBF234914D264A80BA5E1F77B05032F6.description: Experiment with the use of sound for functions such as: helping to establish time or location; transitioning between scenes; creating or changing the mood; increasing suspense; and, enhancing qualifies of various characters.

D471967080F84FC2BD23A9F054A25E9A.description: Demonstrate use of sound equipment and the manipulation of sound quality.

43F988B46578473A854FB958DB57C8B3.description: Review safety precautions and apply safety practices related to sound design.

A7D86C716575431E99236F7F56FE0FCD.description: Examine a variety of analog and digital sound equipment (e.g., microphones, sound boards, equalizers, speakers, headsets) and programs (e.g., digital audio workstation - DAW, QLab) and prepare equipment for use.

FDA78E578AED415095391B88A3CAC0DD.description: Create set design renderings for the same play or scene located in two different performance spaces and build a maquette for one of them, considering physical performance space and aesthetic interpretation.

0A179F1A826B4A8B8CCF9FEC56BD2866.description: Examine the purpose of renderings and explore colour theory, techniques and media (i.e., traditional and digital).

63CBDB5D2F8C4AC19FEFECD24C59F024.description: Examine the limitations and potential of physical performance spaces in the creation of set design, considering factors such as: demands of the stage and/or playing space; sight lines (e.g., including masking requirements); stage dimensions; wing space; effect and location of lighting instruments; and, safety and well-being of performers (e.g., raked stage could have adverse effects on a performer's physical health if the angle of the rake is too steep).

D0FD9BC853C947F3AC529CFDB4EFD5BB.description: Review and explore techniques (e.g., inspirational image bank, thumbnail sketches, ground plans, models) and aesthetic approaches (e.g., minimalism, selective realism, abstraction) used by set designers.

F23F4CD0F7FE4351A274632A40C6B23A.description: Research sources of support (e.g., Professional Association of Canadian Theatres [PACT], Associated Designers of Canada [ADC], performing arts unions, Canadian Centre for Occupational Health and Safety, Canadian Actors’ Equity Association, Theatre Saskatchewan) for psychological health and safety in the theatre.

1ED94BD265DA47EDA6E8D18BF6C17E3A.description: Research accommodations (e.g., modification of work duties, flexible hours, modifications to the work environment) that employees experiencing mental health problems or issues can request.

0B6CF91C79F641C0BD6672C2337FBA98.description: Describe practical ways that theatre employees and employers can contribute to a psychologically healthy and safe workplace.

C25C8E4311C4466EBCBA9A19DCD11CDD.description: Discuss how self-employment and project-based contract work may impact one’s mental and physical health both positively (e.g., pursuing one’s passions, opportunities to be creative, a sense of accomplishment, pride in one’s work) and negatively (e.g., periodic financial stress, rejection of project proposals, long hours leading up to and during show runs followed by periods of less work).

0CC55205B83249AFB0D8B85939E0376F.description: Describe potential challenges in achieving life/work balance in theatre arts careers and discuss ways of maintaining personal wellness.

105A73143D534E9C8DAE7D22CE547EAA.description: Discuss the inclusion of psychological health as a safety concern in the theatre.

2DEB455117DB4ECA9631E2DFD43214B4.description: Examine ways to maintain psychological health and safety in the theatre workplace.

8C48BE190C104E90AE2898F67C409E51.description: Explain health and safety regulations that apply to technical theatre occupations and identify employer and employee responsibilities.

27FB10D9FD44470495BD2E63C44B3F3E.description: Demonstrate consistent and proper use of personal protection equipment or PPE (e.g., dust or ventilation masks, gloves, closed-toe shoes, clothing) and safety procedures (e.g., correct lifting of heavy objects, organization of storage areas, proper use of tools and equipment) in personal theatre arts experiences.

1C565CDC508B4613AC5ACC1314FDF48B.description: Compare a variety of industry safety guidelines and requirements for different areas of the theatre.

FA4DD5ED393C4EDDA057531BB6283379.description: Generate and discuss examples, within the context of theatre arts, of potential workplace hazards and injuries in the four major categories.

8D71A23F56AA45CD98494B129427B26D.description: Differentiate among the four Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) hazard categories, including: physical (e.g., heavy lifting, repetitive motion, slipping/tripping, working at heights, working alone, cuts and burns); chemical (e.g., chemicals, fumes, vapours, gases); biological (e.g., viruses, bacteria, mold, bodily fluids, influenza); and, psychological (e.g., harassment and bullying, stress, fatigue, shift work).

AE26C61A74664C7183F0ED5E403AF5BA.description: Analyze the importance of proper orientation, training, appropriate supervision, theatre inspections and following safe work practices.

E8417E384C8745BCB83B6BF5D9DEA045.description: Discuss how an injury might affect an injured worker and others such as the employer, supervisor, work colleagues, family and friends.

E7AB7BAAFC544197B01F507043549F99.description: Explore risk assessment as it relates to the work area and how it can prevent injuries.

A5ADD1368590403CA89DA5F2170B5560.description: Examine potential hazards in theatre production and apply injury prevention practices.

460B49B38FBE49C18BBD582C3AD10B1C.description: Safety in the Theatre: Hazards and Injury Prevention (Core)
